answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Cook County, IL has an ordinance, Cook County Child Support Ordinance, where a Child Support Affidavit is to be submitted by every applicant/substantial owner for a County building permit or privilege to show they are in full compliance with any child support order before they are entitled to receive or renew such privilege. The link to the ordinance itself cannot be viewed on the website, but the following link provides you with contact information: http://www.cookcountygov.com/portal/server.pt/community/building_and_zoning/235/building_permits
Also, attached is Cook County's Affidavit Child Support Obligation document that is used when one applies for a building permit. I hope this helps.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
A California County is looking for ordinances, resolutions, laws, or codes that say you cannot get permits or licenses (building permits, business licenses, etc) if you have unpaid child support, fines or fees owed to the city/county or unpaid property (secured & unsecured) taxes.  
If your organization has something like this, please forward whatever documents/policies, you have.  Your time and expertise are appreciated!
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
Alliance for Innovation
888-468-6450
title: Unpaid Child Support - Ordinance
